_header: The true process of English policy
Subjects: advice, to magistrates; envoys; political verse; merchants; prologues
_description: The Libel of English Policy, the ‘B’ Text, 1st version — in couplets, with a Prologue of seven stanzas rhyme royal and Envoy of fifteen lines. For the ‘A’ Text, see 5508; for the ‘B’ Text, 2nd version, see 5510.

BodRawPoe32.First Lines:
The trew processe of Engelond pollecyeOf Owteward to kepe this
                    Realme in reste …
BodRawPoe32.Last Lines:
…I offre the them to be graciousTo thyne excuse fare well myn
                    owne trete
BodRawPoe32.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the Prologe of the processe of te bible of Englishe Polycy
                    exortyng alle Engelond to kepe the See environ and namely the narowe See
                    shewynge what profite cometh therof and also what worship and saluacion to
                    Engelond (f. 173); Explicit libellus de polecia (at the end)

BLAdd40673.First Lines:
The trew processe of englishe polecyof onteward to kepe the Raune
                    in Reste…
BLAdd40673.Last Lines:
…I offer the them to be graciousTo thyn excuse fare wele myn
                    own tretice

BLCottVitEX.First Lines:
[T]he trew process of englisch polecyOf outward to kepe the Reame
                    in Rest…
BLCottVitEX.Last Lines:
…chop erle and ba……high wittis
                    l……examyn the……offer
                    theym……thyn expe…
BLCottVitEX.Note:
Damaged by fire. Space left for enlarged capital ‘T’, which
                    was left blank. Folio number reflects the most recent foliation.
BLCottVitEX.Attributed Title:
…the prologue of the bible of…polyce eportinge all englond to
                    kepe the see and namely the narow see shewyng what profite comyth therof and
                    also wurschip and saluacion to englande (f. 184)

HunHM140.First Lines:
The trewe processe of Englisshe pollecye Of vtterwarde to kepe this
                    Realme in rest…
HunHM140.Last Lines:
…I offre the them to be gracious To thyne excuse fare well myne
                    owne tretee
HunHM140.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the Prologe of the Processe of the bible of Englissh[e]
                    policy exortyng alle Englond to kepe the See environ & namely the narrowe
                    See shewyng what profite cometh therof and also what worship and saluacion to
                    Englond (f. 125); Thus endeth the trewe pollecye of the bible of Englissh
                    pollecye exortyng alle Englond to kepe the See enviroun and namely the narowe
                    See (f. 139v); Explicit libellus de polecia Conseruatiua Maris
                    (f. 140)
